title: Why does it cost mana for amumu to cry? (W)
body: It's kinda weird in a way, even if it's an ability still makes no sense lol

replies.body:
Because it's game mechanics translated into something ''physical''.
Besides, tears that damage must be magical, that magic must get it's power from a source. Source is mana.
Topic closed.

Because its a video game so real world logic isnt always going to apply. Why does it cost Gragas mana to drink from his cask? Why does it cost mana for Darius to swing his axe in a circle but doesnt cost mana for Garen to spin his sword in a circle? etc, etc

> [{quoted}](name=Eedat,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jNzrWKKl,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2017-11-23T10:47:12.099+0000)
>
> Because its a video game so real world logic isnt always going to apply. Why does it cost Gragas mana to drink from his cask? Why does it cost mana for Darius to swing his axe in a circle but doesnt cost mana for Garen to spin his sword in a circle? etc, etc

Fair point, but I wish they could make his W a passive instead. Because it doesn't really deal damage, unless you have lots of AP but even then you need to be close to the enemy to apply the damage which is hard considering how most champions have tons of mobility now.

And in terms of balancing this passive the scalings and values can always be changed to make this a balanced passive. The reason why I wish to see this as a passive is because Amumu is a character who is always sad, so making him passively cry would make sense in a way, but that's just my idea it might be a bad one.
My main question honestly is why are his mana costs so high when he's already really bad as a champ.
